results.title: Mother earth, father sky
results.creator_credit: Ford Motor Company and John Holmstrom
results.brief_description: Years ago all America was the outdoors but only the Indians understood the true beauty of it all. As immigrants built roads, the meaning of the outdoors changed and became more accessible. Now outdoor enjoyment tends to be more organised, but whether it is bike riding in Central Park in New York or walking in the Grand Canyon, all interests can be catered for. “By being outdoors we all gain a special look at ourselves through Nature”.

results.title: Mother earth
results.creator_credit: Charles Blanks, Rural Bank of New South Wales and L. Scott-Ehrenberg
results.brief_description: Diary of Brian Gordon. Brian Gordon and his younger brother Michael, Sydneysiders, embark on a trip to rural New South Wales. Taken by the peace and lifestyle of the farming districts, both regret their imminent return to the city. But as luck would have it, Brian meets and falls in love with an orphaned country girl, Marian. Fortunately Brian is able to arrange a Rural Bank of New South Wales loan to assist himself and the cash-strapped Marian save her farm. A patriotic and heroic view of the idealised bush of a by-gone era. NB: A promotional film for the Rural Bank of New South Wales.

results.title: Mother cat and her baby skunks
results.creator_credit: Milan Herzog and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A mother cat finds three baby skunks in the woods that have lost their mother. She adopts them and induces them to return to the farmyard where she has three kittens of her own. The baby skunks and kittens are shown developing side by side. The farm dog lives in harmony with the cat and helps her to protect the babies.

results.title: Mother and Son: Arthur's Night Out
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Geoffrey Portmann and Geoffrey Atherden
results.brief_description:
‘Mother and Son’ was an Australian television comedy series that centred on the relationship between the elderly Maggie Beare (Ruth Cracknell) and her carer son Arthur (Garry McDonald).

In this episode, Arthur’s attempts to enjoy a night out with his estranged wife, Deirdre (Suzanne Roylance) are derailed by Maggie’s determination not to be left out.

First broadcast on 6th February, 1984.

results.title: Mother and son. No. 2
results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell and Gary McDonald play Maggie and Arthur. Maggie appears to be losing her memory but retains enough to take full advantage of having her younger son, Arthur, living at home with her and on call for her needs whether he likes it or not. This program includes the episodes, “The Card Game”; “The Promotion”; “The Funeral”.

results.title: Mother and son. No. 1 (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Geoffrey Portmann and Geoffrey Atherden
results.brief_description: The money : Maggie has been saving up her pension cheques and Arthur needs to find them, but where are they? “The aunt” : Arthur invites Maggie’s sister Lorna for a visit. At first all goes well but then Lorna dares to pick some of Maggie’s flowers… “The accident” : Someone drops a typewriter on Arthur’s foot and he’s stuck at home being nursed by Maggie! Stars Ruth Cracknell and Garry McDonald with Henri Szeps and Judy Morris.

results.title: Mother and son. No. 1
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Geoffrey Atherden and Geoffrey Portmann
results.brief_description: Ruth Cracknell and Gary McDonald are brilliant as Maggie and Arthur. Henri Szeps is Robert, the brother you love to hate, with Judy Morris as his wife, Liz. Maggie appears to be losing her memory, but still knows how to enjoy life. Arthur yearns to be free from the responsibility of caring for Maggie, but he’s stuck, and Maggie makes the most of it. This tape includes three episodes: “The Money” - Maggie has been saving up her pension cheques and hiding them away. “The Aunt” - Arthur invites Maggie’s sister, Lorna, over for a visit. “The Accident” - Arthur injures his foot and Maggie has to look after him.

results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: James McCloy, Brenda Horsfield and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Man in the Making”.
How important is the bond between mother and baby to the future emotional development of the child? Here the latest scientific evidence is examined through experiments with baby rats and monkeys. Experiments on human babies are impossible, but the film shows the effect of depriving babies of mothers or even substitute mothers in cases where this has unfortunately happened. Speakers include: Dr J.A. Ambrose, Dr R.A. Hinde and Dr Seymour Levine.

results.title: Mother and child
results.creator_credit: Eurfron Gwynne Jones, Francis Fuchs and BBC-TV
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Children Growing Up”.
Explores the changing relationship between mother and child from birth to school age. Considers two common family crises involving separation - when either mother or child goes to hospital and the arrival of a new baby. Narrated by Hugh David.
